data.title: Interest] A request to shut down the qt
data.text:
Carlos Smith

Huh, I'd wondered at the dropoff of traffic. I'd assumed people were using the forums more. I must have missed the announcement of the new mailing list.

So, thanks for sending this mail to remind us!

Carlos

-----Original Message-----

From: qt-interest-bounces+csmith=***@qt.nokia.com [mailto:qt-interest-bounces+csmith=***@qt.nokia.com] On Behalf Of K. Frank

Sent: Monday, February 13, 2012 9:12 AM

To: ***@qt-project.org; Qt-interest

Subject: [Qt-interest] [Interest] [Qt-Interest] A request to shut down the qt-***@qt.nokia.com ("Qt-Interest") mailing list

To The List Administrators!

I would like to respectfully request the administrators of the old "Qt-Interest"

mailing list (qt-***@qt.nokia.com) to shut it down, preferably after a clear announcement to that effect, and possibly after a transition period.

This follows the discussion I cross-posted in the following threads:

(old list)

http://lists.qt.nokia.com/pipermail/qt-interest/2012-February/037263.html

(new list)

http://lists.qt-project.org/pipermail/interest/2012-February/000741.html

(Of course, anyone can run any mailing list he wants, so this is only a request. Also, if the Qt-Interest administrators do decide to shut that list down, how they proceed is up to them.)

The reasons for this request are as follows: Having two similar lists fragments the traffic, and it's a minor nuisance following two lists, remembering where to post, and searching the list archives. Also, no one has expressed a desire to keep the old Qt-Interest list going, or suggested a benefit to having two lists (e.g., a different emphasis or different topics covered).

Thanks, and Happy Listing!

K. Frank

_______________________________________________

Qt-interest mailing list

Qt-***@qt.nokia.com

http://lists.qt.nokia.com/mailman/listinfo/qt-interest
